page.title: 17WHAT HAPPENS TO WASTE WATER
page.content: The processes used at Spalding Treatment Works: {Screening _}This removes large sticks and rags etc. {Grit Removal _}Removes sand and grit. This is taken away and buried. {Settlement Tanks _}Large settleable solids settle out to form a sludge which is removed. The sludge is used as a fertilizer on the land. {Biological Filtration Bed _}Bacteria and microrganisims in the filter feed on organic materials in the sewage and purify it. {Humus Settlement Tanks _}Solids settle out to form a sludge which is removed. The water from the top of these tanks is pumped into the River. The buildings at Spalding have only a life of 30 years so they will not be there in thir present form in 50 years
